channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Futures Tick Higher as Election Day Kicks Off
item.description: Stock futures rose modestly and investors focus on election results.

item.title: Euro Faces Hit From Tariffs if Trump Wins Election
item.description: The euro was stronger, but could drop to $1.02 over the next 12 months if Trump secures a second presidential term, with a significant hit from second...

item.title: Marqeta shares plunge more than 30% on big forecast miss
item.description: Marqeta shares plummeted after the company's forecast for the fourth quarter fell shy of analysts' expectations.

item.title: Oil Edges Higher Ahead of U.S. Election
item.description: Oil prices edged higher with all eyes now on the outcome of the U.S. election, the Federal Reserve’s next policy move and China’s National People’s Co...

item.title: Palantir shares surge on rosy revenue outlook
item.description: Palantir is seeing a pickup in artificial intelligence among its U.S. government client base.

item.title: Nintendo profit plunges 69% as it cuts forecast for sales of ageing Switch console
item.description: Investors are waiting for news surrounding a successor to the Switch which they hope will re-energize Nintendo's gaming business.

item.title: Burger King parent Restaurant Brands falls short of third-quarter revenue expectations
item.description: Net sales climbed 24.7%, largely thanks to the company's acquisitions of its largest U.S. Burger King franchisee and its Popeyes business in China.

item.title: Global Investors Brace for U.S. Election Volatility
item.description: Global markets are bracing for a volatile day as U.S. voters head to the polls to elect their next president.

item.title: Uber's Real Threat Isn't From Robots
item.description: The ride-hailing pioneer is contending with slowing bookings growth, rising insurance costs and an alliance between DoorDash and Lyft.

item.title: Oil giant Saudi Aramco posts 15% drop in third-quarter profit but maintains dividend
item.description: Lower global oil prices, weaker demand and prolonged OPEC+ production cuts led by Saudi Arabia continue to impact crude prices.
